hero.title: OPTIMIZE THE TAX STRUCTURE OF YOUR DIGITAL BUSINESS
hero.subtitle: WITH A US LLC
hero.description: For freelancers and digital entrepreneurs who work online and sell internationally.
hero.highlight: Your LLC in 2 days. No VAT. No Corporate Tax. No self-employment fees.

benefits.sectionTitle:
AN EFFICIENT STRUCTURE
SIMPLE AND READY
TO OPERATE INTERNATIONALLY

vat.title: No VAT on LLC
vat.text: The LLC does not apply VAT when invoicing digital services, whether to end consumers or international B2B clients. We structure your activity so that invoicing is done correctly from the US company, without VAT, in accordance with applicable regulations and the type of operation.

taxes.title: 0% Corporate Tax
taxes.text: In states like New Mexico or Wyoming, the LLC is not subject to state corporate tax. The company does not pay tax as a corporation in the United States; instead, profits are attributed directly to the owner, according to the LLC's tax structure.
taxes.button: What taxes are there in USA

fees.title: No fixed fees
fees.text: In the United States, there is no monthly self-employment fee associated with the LLC. There are no mandatory periodic payments simply for having an active company, regardless of whether there is activity or not. The structure maintains low fixed costs and lighter management.

banking.title: Bank accounts
banking.text: We guide you through the process of opening bank accounts at Mercury and Relay. Access a business account in USD, with the ability to receive and send international transfers and have a physical debit and credit card to operate globally.
banking.button: Which banks can I open an account at

ctaSection.title: Shall we start?
ctaSection.subtitle: We're ready to help you. Let's talk whenever you want.

howWeWork.title:
YOUR US COMPANY,
DONE RIGHT FROM THE START
howWeWork.subtitle: We analyze your case, create the right structure and handle all the paperwork so your LLC is born ready to operate, grow and optimize taxes.

listen.title: We listen to your needs
listen.text: We analyze your profile, goals, and the state that best suits your LLC based on your activity.

collect.title: We collect information
collect.text: We request only the minimum necessary data to start the process safely and efficiently.

form.title: We submit the registration
form.text: We process all documentation with the corresponding Secretary of State to formalize your company.

docs.title: Document management
docs.text: We obtain your EIN, Operating Agreement, and all necessary legal documents for operation.

banking.title: Banking assistance
banking.text: We help you open your account in banks like Mercury or Relay so you can start transacting.

compliance.title: Annual compliance
compliance.text: We handle your renewals and reports so your LLC is always in good standing.

followup.title: Continuous follow-up
followup.text: We are by your side to answer questions and support your business growth in the US.

growth.title: Business growth support
growth.text: We support your expansion with guidance on structure, banking, and international operations as your company evolves.

step1.title: STATE REGISTRATION
step1.text: We create your LLC with you and for you. We handle the complete legal process for a stress-free start.

step2.title: EIN INCLUDED
step2.text: We get your US tax number so your company can operate with total peace of mind and legal backing.

step3.title: BANK ACCOUNT
step3.text: We accompany you to open your international account and start moving your business without limits.

whyUs.sectionTitle:
WE HANDLE
YOUR LLC
FROM START TO FINISH

speed.title: Your LLC ready in 2-3 business days
speed.text: We work with an agile, proven and well-organized process from the start. No unnecessary waits or confusing steps. You know what's happening at each phase and when your company will be operational.

transparency.title: Clear pricing
transparency.text: Everything is included from the beginning, with no hidden costs or surprises. What you see is what you pay. We believe trust starts with clarity and honesty in the numbers.

specialists.title: Business specialists
specialists.text: We're not generic intermediaries. We work daily with freelancers and international businesses, understanding their real needs and anticipating problems to make it easy for you from day one.

support.title: Personal attention
support.text: We talk to you person to person, via WhatsApp and email, whenever you need. No endless tickets or automated responses. We're here to accompany you before, during and after the process.

services.title: Our Services
services.subtitle: Everything you need to form and maintain your LLC
services.heroTitle: HOW WE HELP YOU OPERATE YOUR LLC
services.heroSubtitle: We handle the entire process so you have a company ready to operate, grow and optimize its tax burden with complete security.

llc.title: LLC FORMATION
llc.description: Form your US LLC quickly and easily

maintenance.title: Annual Maintenance
maintenance.description: Keep your LLC compliant with our maintenance service

maintenancePack.title: Annual Maintenance
maintenancePack.sectionSubtitle: We handle all legal, tax and administrative obligations of your company so you can focus on growing your business with complete peace of mind.
maintenancePack.trustText: We know that managing a company in the United States can raise questions, especially if you operate from another country. That's why we created a complete maintenance system where we review every legal and tax requirement for you, ensuring everything is filed correctly and on time.
maintenancePack.trustGoal2: for your company to run without interruptions and without stress.
maintenancePack.whatWeDoTitle: What we'll do for you throughout the year

fiscal.title: Mandatory tax management
fiscal.desc: We prepare and file the necessary tax forms with the IRS, controlling deadlines and requirements to avoid penalties or problems with your company.

agent.title: Registered agent renewal
agent.desc: Your LLC needs to maintain an active registered agent to continue operating legally. We manage its annual renewal so your company never falls out of compliance.

annual.title: State annual report filing
annual.desc: Each state requires keeping the company active through periodic reports. We control dates, prepare documentation and file accordingly.

boi.title: BOI Report supervision and update
boi.desc: If relevant data about your company or structure changes, we update the information required by FinCEN to maintain federal compliance.

deadlines.title: Deadline tracking and control
deadlines.desc: We monitor all important dates related to your LLC and notify you in advance so you never miss a legal obligation.

support.title: Specialized continuous support
support.desc: You'll have access to our team to resolve tax, banking or administrative questions related to your company, always with a practical and clear approach.

maintenancePack.emotionalTitle: More than maintenance, real peace of mind
maintenancePack.emotionalText: We want you to have the security that your company is properly managed, even when you're focused on selling, scaling or developing your business. We watch over the legal and administrative side so you can focus on what really matters.
benefits: Keep your company active and compliant
Don't worry about dates or forms
Have real support when you need it
maintenancePack.finalText: Your company is not just created, it's maintained. And we're here to make sure everything keeps working correctly year after year.
maintenancePack.finalTextPart1: Your company is not just created, it's maintained.
maintenancePack.finalTextPart2: And we're here to make sure everything keeps working correctly year after year.

WE BUILD YOUR LLC
WITH LEGAL, BANKING AND TAX VISION
whatWeDo.subtitle: We handle the entire process so you have a company ready to operate, grow and optimize its tax burden with complete security.

formation.title: Official formation
formation.desc: We handle the complete registration of your LLC with the Secretary of State, taking care of all necessary procedures so your company is correctly formed from the start.

ein.title: EIN obtainment
ein.desc: We process your Employer Identification Number (EIN) directly with the IRS, allowing your LLC to be fiscally identified and ready to operate.

banking.title: Bank accounts
banking.desc: We guide you through opening business accounts at Mercury and Relay, with access to USD banking and physical debit and credit cards.

boi.title: BOI Report
boi.desc: We prepare and file the Beneficial Ownership Information Report with FinCEN, complying with current federal requirements for LLCs in the United States.

agent.title: Registered Agent
agent.desc: We include official Registered Agent service for the first full year, providing a legal address in the United States and receiving official notifications.

support.title: Expert support
support.desc: We offer direct and personalized attention to resolve your tax and operational questions, accompanying you in the use and maintenance of your LLC.

stateComparison.title: THE BEST LLC
stateComparison.subtitle: We compare costs, privacy, taxation and maintenance so you can choose wisely and without surprises.

pros: No annual state report required (less bureaucracy)
No state tax on profits if you operate from outside the U.S.
Very popular among freelancers, digital nomads and online businesses
cons: Lower corporate prestige compared to Delaware
Correct legal protection, but not as advanced as Wyoming or Delaware
newMexico.idealIf: You want to launch your business quickly, save costs and operate internationally without administrative complications.
newMexico.tagline: The most practical option to start

pros: High level of privacy for owners
Excellent legal protection of personal assets
Very good reputation for digital businesses
No state income tax for non-residents
cons: Slightly higher cost than New Mexico
wyoming.idealIf: You want a more solid structure, greater legal protection and convey a more professional image.
wyoming.tagline: The perfect balance between security, privacy and cost

pros: Highly developed and stable corporate legislation
Favorite state for startups and venture capital
Very attractive if you plan to raise investment or sell the company
cons: Usually unnecessary for freelancers or small online businesses
delaware.idealIf: Your goal is to build a scalable company, attract investors or prepare a future sale or global expansion.
delaware.tagline: The most strategic option for large projects

quickGuide.title: Which to choose?
quickGuide.easy: If you want to start easy and spend the minimum
quickGuide.protection: If you're looking for protection, privacy and stability
quickGuide.growth: If you want to create a company ready to grow or attract investment

stateComparison.humanMessage: Our job is to help you choose the option that makes the most sense for you, not to sell you the most expensive one.

aboutUs.title: About Exentax
aboutUs.q1: What do we do at Exentax?
aboutUs.a1: We create, structure and manage your LLC in the United States comprehensively. We're not a website that hands you some papers and disappears. We're a consulting firm that accompanies you before, during and after the process. Our goal is for you to have a well-created company from the start, with a structure that works legally, avoiding any surprises due to lack of information and allowing your business to grow without operational or legal blocks. We handle all the bureaucracy so you can focus on selling.
aboutUs.q2: What's included in the formation package?
aboutUs.a2: It includes absolutely everything necessary for your company to be born and fully operational from day one: Official LLC registration with the state, drafting of Articles of Organization, a personalized and professional Operating Agreement, a physical commercial address in the United States to receive official correspondence, the legally required Registered Agent, initial BOI (Beneficial Ownership Report) registration with FinCEN, express formation in 3 business days and support with unlimited consultations so you never feel alone.
aboutUs.q3: What's NOT included in the base package?
aboutUs.a3: It doesn't include services that depend directly on your billing or specific activity: Direct bank account opening (although we guide you step by step, the final decision is the bank's), annual tax filings, Sales Tax registration, monthly accounting services or personal immigration procedures. These additional services are activated modularly when your business really needs them to operate at large scale.
aboutUs.q4: Do you provide a US address?
aboutUs.a4: Yes, of course. We provide you with a real physical commercial address valid for banks, payment platforms (Stripe, Wise), official state registrations and tax documentation before the IRS. It's not a simple cheap forwarding postal box; it's a real business management address. Without a professional address in the United States, your company won't be able to pass the security verifications of neobanks or modern payment gateways.

keyConcepts.title: Key Concepts and Procedures
keyConcepts.a1: The EIN (Employer Identification Number) is your company's federal tax identification number in the United States, equivalent to the NIF or CIF in other countries. It's the most important document: you need it mandatorily to open business bank accounts, invoice clients, hire employees, file taxes with the IRS and verify your accounts on Stripe, Wise and Amazon. Without a validated EIN, your company exists legally but is completely inoperative in the financial system.
keyConcepts.a2: It's the fundamental internal contract of your company. This document sets the rules of the game: who are the owners (members), what percentage of participation each one has, who has decision-making power, how profits are distributed and what happens legally if a partner wants to leave or enter the company. US banks require it as an essential requirement to open an account and it's your main defense against any legal dispute or audit.
keyConcepts.q3: What are the Articles of Organization?
keyConcepts.a3: It's the official birth certificate of your company, the document we file with the Secretary of State to create the legal entity. It includes crucial public data such as the LLC's name, the state of formation (Wyoming or New Mexico), the official physical address and the identity of the Registered Agent. Once stamped by the state, this document confirms that your limited liability has begun and that your personal assets are protected.
keyConcepts.a4: It's a mandatory figure by law in all states. It's the entity or person in charge of receiving on your behalf all official government notifications, legal requirements, court summons and tax notices. We act as your official Registered Agent: we process all important correspondence, notify you immediately and advise you on what actions to take. Not having one is grounds for immediate dissolution of your company by the state.
keyConcepts.a5: It's the 'Beneficial Ownership Information' registration required by the Treasury Department (FinCEN). The US government requires knowing who the natural persons that actually own or control the company are to prevent illicit activities. It's not an optional procedure and non-compliance can carry extreme civil fines of up to $500 for each day of delay or criminal penalties of up to $10,000.

taxes.title: Taxes and Compliance
taxes.q1: What taxes does an LLC pay?
taxes.a1: Taxation depends entirely on how the company is structured and the residence of its owners. Most LLCs operate as 'disregarded' (transparent) entities, which means the company itself doesn't pay corporate tax in the United States, but the profit flows to the owners. If you don't have a physical presence or employees in the US and provide digital services, it's very likely that your federal tax burden is 0%, paying taxes only in your country of residence. Each case is unique and we provide you with the necessary initial guidance.
taxes.q2: Is there VAT in the United States?
taxes.a2: No, in the United States there is no VAT (Value Added Tax) as known in Europe or Latin America. Instead, there is 'Sales Tax', which is a state and local tax. It's only collected if you sell physical products to end customers in states where your company has 'nexus' (legal or economic presence). For digital services and software (SaaS) sold outside the US, there are generally no indirect taxes to collect.
taxes.a3: The United States is one of the few countries that doesn't participate in the automatic exchange of banking information system known as CRS (Common Reporting Standard). Instead, it uses its own system called FATCA. This means that bank accounts opened in the US by foreigners aren't automatically reported through the CRS system used by almost all of Europe and Latin America, offering a higher level of financial privacy, as long as the user complies with their individual legal obligations.
taxes.a4: They are mandatory annual informational filings with the IRS. Form 5472 reports transactions between the LLC and its foreign owners (loans, capital contributions, payments). Failure to file this form carries an automatic minimum penalty of $25,000. Form 1120 is the corporation's tax return that accompanies the 5472. They must be filed even if the company has had no commercial activity or billing during the year.
taxes.a5: It's an annual maintenance report required by states like Wyoming to confirm that the company is still active and that its contact information is correct. It includes payment of a state maintenance fee. If you don't file this report before the deadline, the state will change your company's status to 'Delinquent' and eventually dissolve it, losing you all limited liability protection.
taxes.q6: What taxes exist in the United States?
taxes.a6:
There are several levels of taxes in the United States:

1. Federal Taxes (IRS) - These are national taxes applied by the federal government. They include corporate tax, business income tax, taxes on US-sourced income and informational obligations (mandatory reports).

2. State Taxes - Each state can apply its own taxes such as Franchise Tax, State Income Tax, Annual Report Fees and state Business Taxes. They depend on the state where the LLC is registered or where it operates.

3. Sales Tax - This is the equivalent of European VAT. It applies when you sell physical products, have tax nexus in a state or exceed certain sales volumes.

4. Local Taxes - Some cities or counties apply additional rates, although they usually don't affect international digital businesses.
taxes.q7: What taxes do NOT apply to non-residents?
taxes.a7:
In the typical international online business model, these taxes normally do NOT apply to non-residents:

• Federal corporate tax
• State income tax on profits
• General American VAT
• US Social Security

**Important:** Just because an LLC doesn't pay taxes in the US doesn't mean you have no tax obligations in your country of residence. Depending on where you live, you may have to declare profits there.

taxExtensions.title: Tax Extensions
taxExtensions.a1: A tax extension is an official request to the IRS that allows you to extend the deadline for filing your tax returns. It doesn't eliminate the obligation to file the forms, but it gives you more time to prepare them correctly and avoid penalties. For non-resident LLCs, it extends the deadline for filing mandatory forms like IRS Form 1120 and IRS Form 5472.
taxExtensions.q2: How does a tax extension help me?
taxExtensions.a2: The extension protects you against one of the biggest risks of an LLC: late filing penalties. The IRS can impose very high penalties if these forms are not filed on time, even if the company has no activity or taxes to pay. Requesting the extension allows you to avoid penalties, have more time to prepare documentation, properly review your accounting and comply with the IRS safely and professionally.
taxExtensions.q3: Is the tax extension included in Exentax?
taxExtensions.a3: Yes. We handle requesting the extension as part of our services so your company complies with IRS deadlines without complications. Our goal is to protect your LLC against penalties, help you correctly comply with your tax obligations and provide real support throughout the entire process.

operations.title: Operations and Platforms
operations.q1: Can I use my LLC to collect payments on Stripe or Wise?
operations.a1: Yes, that's precisely one of the biggest benefits of having an LLC. With your federal EIN, professional Operating Agreement and certified commercial address, you can open business accounts on these platforms without the blocks that personal accounts from high-risk countries often suffer. We advise you on how to present the technical documentation correctly to pass the 'Know Your Customer' (KYC) processes and avoid unjustified fund holds.
operations.q2: What happens if a platform blocks my account?
operations.a2: A block is not always definitive, it's usually a routine security check. We help you analyze what specific documents they're requesting, prepare the appropriate technical response with your Articles of Organization and EIN, and tell you how to send the information so that a human support agent approves it. Most accounts are unblocked in a few days if the response is professional and well documented.
operations.q3: Can I change my LLC's state later?
operations.a3: Not easily. At Exentax we don't perform 'Domestication' (state transfer) procedures because it's a costly and bureaucratic process that often generates tax errors. If your business changes radically and you need to operate in a different state, the most efficient and safe option is usually to close the current entity and create a new LLC or register the current one as a foreign entity in the new state. That's why it's vital to choose well between Wyoming and New Mexico from day one.
operations.q4: Can I use it living in Europe?
operations.a4: Yes, the LLC is the favorite optimization tool for digital nomads and entrepreneurs residing in Europe. It allows you to invoice globally with a US structure while complying with the regulations of your country of residence. It's a perfectly legal way to separate your personal assets from business ones and operate in a market with less bureaucracy than the European one.
operations.q5: Does it work for Amazon, SaaS, Freelancing, Crypto?
operations.a5: Absolutely. The LLC is an extremely versatile entity that adapts to any digital business model. Whether you're an Amazon FBA seller who needs access to the American market, a software developer with a SaaS model, a freelancer who invoices international clients or an investor in cryptoassets looking for legal protection, the US LLC is the reference structure worldwide for its flexibility and prestige.
operations.q6: Will I receive a physical card?
operations.a6: Yes. Once your bank account is approved, you can request and receive physical debit and credit cards issued by our banking partner Mercury, allowing you to operate internationally, make payments and manage your business normally. It's important to note that banking approval depends exclusively on the financial institution. Although we cannot guarantee it, our team accompanies you throughout the process and optimizes your application to maximize the chances of success.
operations.q7: Do you provide an American phone number for my LLC?
operations.a7: It's not necessary in most cases. To operate an LLC in the United States, you normally don't need a US phone number. If you need one for operational or commercial reasons, there are very simple digital solutions that allow you to obtain professional virtual numbers. If you require it, we can guide you on the best options for your business.
operations.q8: How much does it cost to dissolve my LLC?
operations.a8: The standard cost to dissolve an LLC is €350 in simple cases, when the company has no debts, pending obligations or administrative issues. In more complex situations, such as LLCs with prior activity, debts, non-compliance or additional procedures with the state or IRS, the cost can start from €500, depending on the level of regularization needed. Before starting the process, we review your case and inform you with full transparency about the cost and steps to follow.
operations.q9: What are the differences between Mercury and Relay?
operations.a9: Mercury and Relay are two banking solutions widely used by US companies, especially by digital business LLCs. Both allow managing payments, receiving transfers and operating internationally, but they have different approaches. Mercury is primarily aimed at digital entrepreneurs, startups and online businesses. It offers a very simple banking experience, physical and virtual cards, and great compatibility with platforms like Stripe, PayPal or accounting tools. It's usually a very popular option for single-owner LLCs or simple structures. Relay, on the other hand, is more focused on financial management of companies with teams or multiple managers. It allows creating multiple cards, assigning permissions to different users and controlling expenses in more detail. It's especially useful when the business needs to separate expenses by departments or people. Both options are reliable and allow operating with a US LLC. The choice mainly depends on the type of business, company structure and operational needs. At Exentax we help you prepare your company to apply for bank accounts with partners compatible with your activity, although final approval always depends on each financial institution.

pdf.title: OPERATING AGREEMENT
pdf.intro: This Operating Agreement is prepared by Exentax, acting as a corporate formation and compliance service provider, on behalf of its client, and becomes effective as of:
pdf.section1Content: This Agreement confirms the internal structure, ownership, and operating principles of {{companyName}}, a Limited Liability Company legally formed under the laws of the State of {{state}}. The Company was created to operate as a legitimate business entity, providing services and conducting commercial activities within the United States and internationally.
pdf.section3Intro: The Company is owned by a single Member.
pdf.section3Outro: The Member holds full legal and operational control of the Company.
pdf.section4Intro: The Company has been established to carry out lawful commercial activities including but not limited to:
pdf.purpose5: Any other lawful activity permitted under applicable law
pdf.section4Outro: The Company may operate both domestically and internationally.
pdf.section5Intro: The Company is managed directly by its Member. The Member has full authority to:
pdf.management3: Open and manage business bank accounts
pdf.management4: Work with financial institutions and payment processors
pdf.management6: Handle accounting, compliance, and reporting matters
pdf.section6Content: The Member confirms that initial capital has been contributed to support Company operations.
pdf.section6Outro: Additional funding may be introduced by the Member when required.
pdf.section7Content: All Company profits and losses belong exclusively to the Member. Distributions may be taken at the Member's discretion, considering business stability and financial obligations.
pdf.section8Intro: The Company is treated as a disregarded entity for U.S. federal tax purposes unless an alternative election is made. The Company commits to maintaining compliance with all applicable filing requirements, including:
pdf.section9Content: The Company will maintain separate business financial accounts. The Member agrees to maintain proper separation between personal and Company funds and to operate the business transparently and responsibly.
pdf.section10Content: The Company exists as a separate legal entity. The Member shall not be personally responsible for Company liabilities except where required by law.
pdf.section11Intro: The Company agrees to maintain accurate and organized records including:
pdf.section11Outro: Records may be stored digitally or physically.
pdf.section12Content: Ownership may only be transferred by decision of the Member and in accordance with applicable laws.
pdf.section13Content: The Company may be dissolved voluntarily by the Member or as required by law. Upon dissolution, Company assets shall be used to settle liabilities before distributing remaining funds to the Member.
pdf.section14Intro: The Member confirms that Company funding originates from legitimate sources including:
pdf.section14Outro: The Company commits to operating within applicable financial regulations and anti-money laundering standards.
pdf.section15Content: This Agreement has been prepared by Exentax to support corporate structuring and documentation of the Company. Exentax does not assume ownership, management control, or fiduciary responsibility for the Company unless explicitly agreed in writing.
pdf.section16Content: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of {{state}}.
pdf.confirmationText: By signing below, the Member confirms that the information provided is accurate and agrees to operate the Company responsibly and in compliance with applicable regulations.

homeFaq.titlePart1: Learn how an LLC can help you
homeFaq.subtitle: Legal, transparent, and explained so you truly understand it.
homeFaq.ctaText: Want to know if an LLC fits your business?

legal.question: Is it legal for a foreigner to have an LLC in the United States?
legal.answer: Yes. Setting up an LLC in the United States is completely legal for non-residents. The key is structuring it correctly based on your country of residence and activity. That's where we help you.

taxes.question: Can an LLC really help optimize taxes?
taxes.answer: In many cases yes, but it depends on your personal situation and business model. We analyze your profile to ensure it's an efficient and safe structure for you.

travel.question: Do I need to travel to the United States to create the company?
travel.answer: No. The entire process is done online. We handle the registration, tax documentation and banking support without you having to travel.

timeline.question: How long does it take for my LLC to be operational?
timeline.answer: Usually between 48 and 72 hours for incorporation. Then we help you with the EIN, bank account and tax setup so you can operate normally.

after.question: What happens after creating the LLC?
after.answer: We don't leave you on your own. We help you with tax compliance, reminders, documentation, ongoing support and tools to keep your company in good standing.

businesses.question: What types of businesses is an LLC recommended for?
businesses.answer: Freelancers, agencies, e-commerce, software, consultants and digital businesses that operate internationally typically benefit from this type of structure.

contact.question: Can I talk to someone before signing up?
contact.answer: Of course. You can talk to us before making any decision. We prefer that you fully understand everything before getting started.

legalTerms.title: Terms and
legalTerms.s01p1: Exentax is a trade name used for the provision of administrative and business management services. The legal entity responsible for the services is:
legalTerms.s01p2: Exentax Holdings LLC operates under the trade name Exentax for the provision of services to clients worldwide.
legalTerms.s02p1: Exentax Holdings LLC, under the Exentax brand, provides administrative, management and business support services, specializing in the formation and maintenance of limited liability companies (LLC) in the United States, aimed at national and international clients.
legalTerms.s02p2: Exentax is not a law firm, nor a regulated legal, tax or financial advisory firm, and does not provide legal representation or regulated professional advice. All information provided is administrative, informational and guidance-oriented. The client is responsible for consulting with qualified professionals (lawyers, tax advisors or accountants) when their situation requires it.
legalTerms.s03p1: Exentax offers, among others, the following administrative services:
legalTerms.s03item2: Processing and filing of Articles of Organization
legalTerms.s03item4: Obtaining the EIN from the IRS
legalTerms.s03item9: Administrative support during the service period
legalTerms.s03note: Services are provided on an administrative basis, based on information provided by the client.
legalTerms.s04p1: Prices shown include state formation fees, as well as the services detailed in each package at the time of contracting. Prices may be subject to update, without affecting services already contracted and paid for.
legalTerms.s05p1: Once all required information and documentation has been received correctly, the estimated timeframe for LLC formation is 2 to 3 business days, depending on the state and the agencies involved.
legalTerms.s05p2: The client acknowledges that these timeframes are estimates and may be affected by delays caused by public authorities, state agencies, financial institutions or other third parties beyond Exentax's control.
legalTerms.s06p1: Formation and maintenance packages have a duration of 12 months from the service activation date, unless expressly stated otherwise. Once this period ends, the client may contract additional maintenance packages, whose terms and conditions will be governed by those in effect at the time of contracting.
legalTerms.s07p1: Registered Agent service is included for the first 12 months in packages that indicate so. After this period ends, the client is responsible for renewing this service, either with Exentax or with a provider of their choice.
legalTerms.s07p2: Exentax will not be responsible for penalties, fines or consequences arising from failure to renew the Registered Agent once the included period has ended.
legalTerms.s08Title: Extended Timeframes and Right of Rejection
legalTerms.s08p1: The client acknowledges and accepts that, although the usual estimated timeframe for LLC formation is 2 to 3 business days, in certain cases the process may extend up to a maximum of 15 business days, due to additional verifications, information requirements, administrative workloads of competent agencies or any circumstance beyond Exentax's control.
legalTerms.s08p2: Exentax reserves the right to reject, suspend or not accept a request at its sole discretion, especially when the information provided is incomplete, inconsistent, inaccurate or does not meet the company's internal criteria. In these cases, Exentax will not be obligated to justify the decision or continue with the process.
legalTerms.s09p1: All services offered by Exentax must be paid in advance. Payment implies express acceptance of these Terms and Conditions.
legalTerms.s09p2: Given that the services provided by Exentax are administrative, personalized and of immediate execution, no refunds, total or partial, are accepted once the process has begun, documentation has been submitted to public bodies or procedures have been carried out on behalf of the client.
legalTerms.s09p3: The client understands that costs associated with state fees, official registrations, form filing and administrative management are non-recoverable.
legalTerms.s10p1: Exentax offers assistance and support in the process of opening bank accounts and financial platforms. However, the client acknowledges that:
legalTerms.s10item1: Exentax does not guarantee the approval of bank accounts or payment platforms.
legalTerms.s10item2: Final decisions depend exclusively on financial entities and independent third parties.
legalTerms.s10item3: Exentax has no control over the internal criteria or risk policies of these entities.
legalTerms.s10item4: Exentax will not be responsible for rejections, blocks, account closures or additional documentation requests.
legalTerms.s11item1: Provide truthful, complete and up-to-date information at all times.
legalTerms.s11item2: Provide valid, current and legitimate documentation.
legalTerms.s11item3: Use the LLC and contracted services in accordance with applicable law.
legalTerms.s11item4: Not use the services for illicit, fraudulent purposes or contrary to current regulations.
legalTerms.s11p2: Exentax will not be responsible for errors, delays or penalties resulting from incorrect or false information provided by the client.
legalTerms.s12p1: These Terms and Conditions are governed by the laws in force in the United States of America, specifically in the states of New Mexico, Wyoming or Delaware, as applicable to the jurisdiction of formation of the entity. Any dispute will be resolved before the competent courts of that jurisdiction.

legalPrivacy.title: Privacy
legalPrivacy.s01sub1p1: This Privacy Policy describes how Exentax, operating under the legal name Exentax Holdings LLC, collects, uses, stores, protects and shares the personal information of users of our services and platform.
legalPrivacy.s01sub2p1: Exentax is committed to protecting the privacy and security of our users' personal data in accordance with industry best practices and applicable data protection laws, including:
legalPrivacy.s01sub2item1: European Union General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
legalPrivacy.s01sub2item2: California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA)
legalPrivacy.s01sub2item3: Spain's Organic Law on Data Protection and Guarantee of Digital Rights (LOPDGDD)
legalPrivacy.s01sub2item4: Other applicable data protection laws according to the user's jurisdiction
legalPrivacy.s02sub1p1: When you create an account, we collect:
legalPrivacy.s02sub2p1: To comply with AML/KYC regulations and the Corporate Transparency Act, we collect:
legalPrivacy.s02sub2item1: Official identification document (passport, ID card, driver's license)
legalPrivacy.s02sub3item4: Information about LLC members and managers
legalPrivacy.s03sub1item2: Submit documents to state and federal authorities
legalPrivacy.s03sub1item3: Obtain EIN numbers from the IRS
legalPrivacy.s03sub1item4: Prepare and file BOI Reports with FinCEN
legalPrivacy.s03sub1item6: Prepare and file tax returns (Form 1120, Form 5472)
legalPrivacy.s03sub1item8: Provide access to the platform and its tools
legalPrivacy.s03sub2item4: Provide updates on contracted service status
legalPrivacy.s03sub2item5: Respond to inquiries and support requests
legalPrivacy.s03sub2item6: Send important notifications about service or policy changes
legalPrivacy.s04p1: We may share personal information with the following third parties when necessary for service provision:
legalPrivacy.s04item1: State government agencies (Secretary of State offices)
legalPrivacy.s05p1: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect personal data, including:
legalPrivacy.s05item1: Encryption of data in transit and at rest
legalPrivacy.s06p1: Depending on your jurisdiction, you may have the following rights regarding your personal data:
legalPrivacy.s06item1: Right of access - obtain a copy of your personal data
legalPrivacy.s06item2: Right of rectification - correct inaccurate data
legalPrivacy.s06item3: Right of erasure - request deletion of your data
legalPrivacy.s06p2: To exercise these rights, contact us at hola@exentax.com
legalPrivacy.s07p1: We retain personal data for as long as necessary to provide services and comply with legal obligations. Retention periods vary based on the type of data and legal requirements.
legalPrivacy.s08p1: For questions about this Privacy Policy or to exercise your data protection rights, contact us at:

legalRefunds.title: Refund
legalRefunds.s01p1: Given the administrative, personalized, and immediate execution nature of the services provided by Exentax, refunds are generally not accepted once the service process has begun.
legalRefunds.s01p2: The client understands and accepts that the costs associated with state fees, official registrations, form filing, and administrative management are non-recoverable.
legalRefunds.s02p1: The following services and fees are non-refundable under any circumstances:
legalRefunds.s02item1: State fees paid to government agencies
legalRefunds.s02item7: Any service where documentation has been submitted to public bodies
legalRefunds.s03p1: In exceptional circumstances, partial refunds may be considered:
legalRefunds.s03item1: If the client cancels before any documentation is prepared or submitted
legalRefunds.s03item2: If Exentax is unable to complete the service due to internal reasons
legalRefunds.s03item3: If there is a documented error on our part that prevents service completion
legalRefunds.s03p2: Each case will be evaluated individually. Any approved refund will exclude state fees and third-party costs already incurred.
legalRefunds.s04p1: Exentax reserves the right to reject, suspend, or not accept a request at its sole discretion, especially when:
legalRefunds.s04item1: The information provided is incomplete, inconsistent, or inaccurate
legalRefunds.s04item2: The documentation does not meet required standards
legalRefunds.s04item3: The request does not meet the company's internal criteria
legalRefunds.s04item4: There are suspicions of fraudulent or illegal activity
legalRefunds.s04p2: In cases of rejection before service initiation, a refund may be processed minus any administrative fees incurred.
legalRefunds.s05p1: Exentax provides assistance in the bank account opening process. However:
legalRefunds.s05item1: We do not guarantee the approval of bank accounts or payment platforms
legalRefunds.s05item2: Final decisions depend exclusively on financial entities
legalRefunds.s05item3: Rejection by a bank or financial institution does not entitle to a refund
legalRefunds.s05item4: Additional documentation requests from banks do not constitute grounds for refund
legalRefunds.s06p1: If you believe you have a valid case for a refund review, please contact us:
legalRefunds.s06p2: Please include your order number and a detailed explanation of your situation.
legalRefunds.s06p3: We will respond within 5 business days with our decision.
legalRefunds.s07p1: By contracting our services and making payment, the client expressly accepts this Refund Policy and acknowledges understanding that the services are non-refundable once the process has begun.

legalCookies.title: Cookie
legalCookies.s01p1: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device when you visit our website. They help us provide you with a better experience by remembering your preferences and understanding how you use our platform.
legalCookies.s02sub1p1: These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly and cannot be disabled. They include:
legalCookies.s02sub2p1: These cookies enable enhanced functionality and personalization:
legalCookies.s02sub2item1: Remember form data for easier completion
legalCookies.s02sub3p1: We use analytics cookies to understand how visitors interact with our website:
legalCookies.s02sub3item1: Google Analytics - to analyze website traffic and user behavior
legalCookies.s02sub3item2: Performance monitoring - to identify and fix issues
legalCookies.s02sub3item3: Usage statistics - to improve our services
legalCookies.s03p1: Some cookies are placed by third-party services that appear on our pages:
legalCookies.s03p2: These third parties have their own privacy policies governing the use of their cookies.
legalCookies.s04sub1p1: These are temporary cookies that are deleted when you close your browser. They are used for maintaining your session while you navigate our website.
legalCookies.s04sub2p1: These cookies remain on your device for a set period or until you delete them. They are used for:
legalCookies.s05p1: You can control and manage cookies in several ways:
legalCookies.s05item1: Browser settings - most browsers allow you to refuse or delete cookies
legalCookies.s05item2: Device settings - you can adjust privacy settings on your device
legalCookies.s05item3: Third-party opt-outs - you can opt out of analytics tracking
legalCookies.s05warning: Please note that disabling essential cookies may affect the functionality of our website and prevent you from using certain features.
legalCookies.s06p1: In addition to cookies, we use local storage for:
legalCookies.s06item1: Saving draft LLC and maintenance applications
legalCookies.s07p1: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or for other operational, legal, or regulatory reasons. The date of the last update is shown at the top of this page.
legalCookies.s08p1: If you have questions about our use of cookies, please contact us:

hero.title:
You don't need another company.
You need the right structure.
hero.subtitle:
Most online businesses overpay taxes simply because they operate with the wrong setup.
We help you fix that legally and safely.

tax.title: Tax optimization
tax.desc: Legally reduce your tax burden with a US LLC structure.

global.title: Global operations
global.desc: Access international markets, payment gateways, and USD banking.

fast.title: Fast process
fast.desc: Your LLC ready in 3-5 business days with all documentation included.

support.title: Ongoing support
support.desc: Support in your language throughout the process and annual maintenance.

steps.title: Get started in 3 simple steps
steps.subtitle: We want you to understand everything from the start and make decisions with peace of mind. No jargon, no pressure, and someone guiding you every step of the way.

s1.title: Tell us how your business works
s1.desc: We want to understand how you work, where you sell, how you get paid, and what your goals are. We analyze your situation realistically and will tell you honestly whether you can legally optimize your taxes and if this structure is right for you. If it's not for you, we'll tell you that too.

s2.title: We talk with you, no strings attached
s2.desc: You'll have a direct conversation with our team where you can ask everything you need. We'll explain how your structure would work, its advantages, existing obligations, and how day-to-day operations would look. We want you to have complete clarity before making any decision.

s3.title: We take care of everything
s3.desc: If you decide to move forward, we handle the entire process so you don't have to worry about paperwork, documentation, or complex procedures. We form your company, organize the administrative side, and guide you until you can start operating with confidence, clarity, and peace of mind. And we stay with you afterward, so your structure works correctly long-term.

cta.title: Want to know if this structure fits you?
cta.subtitle:
Book a free consultation and we'll review your case with you personally.
We'll answer your questions, analyze your situation, and tell you clearly whether you can legally optimize your taxes.
cta.note: No commitment. No pressure. Just clear information so you can make the best decision.
